It is achieved by neuronal morphology, glia, vascular, and metabolism changes.
It involves morphological dendritic changes and adaptations in the number of synapses, synapse size, and metabolic activity (Fridriksson & Smith, 2016).

External effectsÂ (e.g., behavioral treatment, task learning and sensory-motor experiences, cortical stimulation).
It is achieved by neuronal morphology, glia, vascular, and metabolism changes.
It involves morphological dendritic changes and adaptations in the number of synapses, synapse size, and metabolic activity (Fridriksson & Smith, 2016).
It triggers structural changes, such as modifying existing connections or generating new circuits at the neuronal level.
Two types: Adaptive (Improve) and Maladaptive (Worsen) changes
